intro: Chionohebe densifolia, commonly known as the dense-leaved rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It is often found in the South Island and some parts of the North Island. Chionohebe densifolia is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
